title: Gamification-Based Design to Enhance Motivation in Mathematics Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Game-based math problem-solving activities conducted on individual devices. Motivates learners through real-time interaction and competitive elements

learning_goals: Learners can solve algebraic problems presented in a gamification environment with 85% accuracy.
Participants execute self-directed learning strategies at least three times using the "Control" element (granting choice) within the game.
Students achieve satisfaction scores of 4.0/5.0 or higher on an intrinsic motivation scale survey after the game experience.
